dialog: We got a truckie pull up to check his trailers.
Heard a wild dog growlin' from here under the bridge.
How'd he know it was a wild dog?
Guess he just knows the difference, I s'pose, you know, between a wild dog and a... wild kind of normal dog.
Who let Macca talk to the truckie?
I've cleared off all the dust off the truck.
Guess he just, uh, let himself, mate.
So the other ones there belong to the truck driver.
Why isn't this crime scene locked off?
I didn't think we'd worry about it out here, Jay.
I'll send a car out, then, eh?
Nice to see you back, Detective.
Laceration to the throat, consistent with a knife wound.
A few posttrauma wounds around the upper arm.
Yeah. Truckie said he heard a dog growling in here.
But he said it was a wild one.
How did he know it was a wild dog, Jay?
I was, uh... I was reading about wild dogs.
They were terrorising a town in Russia or someplace.
The people were too scared to go out at night.
the dogs had learnt to travel on the subway.
They'd take the latenight trains into the city and scavenge for food, and then take the early morning train back out.
It's a crazy world, getting crazier.
Looks like a wild grass seed.
That's basically when I found the body.
Hope they taught you something down there in the smoke.
I haven't seen her in a while.
Sarge, you know I've had nothing like this.
But sooner or later, you were gonna get it.
I guess today's your lucky day.
So, what can you give me?
I got every spare wheel on the drug squad or the theft squad.
You're just gonna have to ride bareback for a while.
There's too much shit going down.
Things have changed since you've been away.
we got a young girl stuffed under the highway.
Just see what you can come up with.
This is your first big case.
You'll be surprised how much I can help you out.
We'll see what happens. If I need your help, I'll let you know.
WOMAN: Muckin' up all the time.
She was found dead this morning.
She was found under the highway...
She's been there a few days.
You know if anyone wanted to hurt Julie?
much about what she was up to these days.
When was the last time you saw her?
Oh, I don't remember what day it was now.
She had a silver necklace with her name on it.
I gave it to her when she was little.
I need a drink or somethin'.
You got a loan there, Bread?
I still see you're dyeing your hair.
Ah, no good. Them kids, they busted me out again.  How's the neighbourhood?
Oh, she's pretty wild these days, nephew.
Lots of drugs and shit goin' on.
A few new drug labs started up out of town.
There's more than enough people walkin' around on the gear, goin' schizo.
You know Julie Mason, who belongs to Ashley?
What do you know about her?
Well, Julie's into a bit of shit.
I know she owes a lot of fellas money.
People say she's been goin' out with truckies.
Well, having sex with them for money.
The trucks pick 'em up just outta town...
and they usually take 'em up out there and park...
I seen her getting around with that, um, Tarni Williams.
She lives in your old street.
It's a greenroof house across from the redroof house.
Time to get my money back, eh?
Just wanna ask you a few questions.
Now I'd just like to start by saying, Frank...
Seriously, it's been a long time.
And I reckon the drug squad's just gonna be lost without ya, eh, Johnno?
Ah, it's gonna be hard to replace you.
Jesus, it's hard to replace anyone out here.
As you know, this joint was robbed five times last month.
And just last week, a junkie held a knife to a woman's throat.
Just across the road from here.
And let us never forget poor young Constable Bobby Rogers.
Who died last year in the line of the duty.
Jesus, maybe we should all shoot through while we still can.
But for some of us, It's the only home we know.
And we gotta stop the rot.
And protect our way of life.
We hope you're gonna think of us...
when you're sinkin' cold ones on that tropical isle.
Here about that girl, are ya?
I can tell you now I don't know nothin' about it.
Well, that might be true, but I still need to ask you a few questions.
I got a herd of cattle here I gotta drench. Won't get done by itself.
Mr Bailey, do you remember seeing any train stopping down on the highway...
Mostly truckies checkin' their load, I guess.
What about last Friday or Saturday night?
Like I said, I don't know nothin' about it.
Do you remember seeing anything strange out here lately?
We got these wild dogs running round everywhere.
Killed two of me young calves last week.
these young hoodlums come out from town, tryin' to steal everything I own.
Yeah, I got signs and guard dogs and bloody car alarms.
Don't stop their little black hands gettin' on somethin'.
Are you a real copper or are you...
one of them black trackers who turns on his own type?
How much land you got here, Mr Bailey?
Well, your children will have a pretty good future, then, won't they, eh?
You know your way back to town, don't you?
He had a smile on him like a shot fox.
Look, I'm gonna have to get back to ya, Jack.
What do you know about young girls prostituting to truck drivers...
Yeah, well, I wanna put a sting on the truck drivers.
We'll put a young girl out on the highway...
and we'll get a pool of suspects.
Where am I gonna get the men for that?
What makes you think you're looking for a truckie?
Come on, Sarge, this shit has to be cleaned up anyway.
One war at a time, Jay.
I'll put in a request for a reward for information.
That's the best I can do.
Jay, got Jim on line one for you.
JIM:  Approximate time of death occurred sometime, oh...
is definitely from the laceration across the trachea, probably from a, say, Like a hunting knife?
And the bite marks are definitely from a dog, a bloody big one.
Hang on a sec. Yeah, yeah.
was found in one of the girl's fingernails.
It's been sent away for analysis.
Oh, I really couldn't say, mate.
Well, what about the blood tests?
Pretty much came up with a blank except for...
How's your old man's Winchester holding up?
Yeah, don't make 'em like that anymore.
Well, what can I do you for?
What have you got in the way of hunting knives?
This is the range I got here, but I could, uh...
get somethin' in special on order if you want.
Give us a look at that big Blackhawk you got there.
You sold many of these lately?
Pig hunters and roo shooters just love 'em.
Do you remember who you might've sold them to?
Memory's not what it used to be and...
only take cash for those, so I got no records.
This wouldn't have anything to do with that...
girl they found on the highway?
But I'll take a box of your best .308s... hollow points.
How you going, my little brothers?
BOY âª2: Who you lookin' for?
I found a phone like that.
Well, you tell me what you did with that phone first...
and I'll give you a look at my gun.
You're not allowed to look at it!
Yeah, uh... heard you were a big detective now.
So you must be on good money, eh?
I'm not gonna back away from a fight, am I?
Not here to see your daughter?
How you goin' with your mother?
Are you good friends with Tarni?
What did Julie call you about?
She never said anything about it.
Did you know she was goin' with truckies?
Crystal, maybe you should come live with me for a while.
Get out of here for a few months. It'll do you good.
Or what about I get a job for ya?
Like in a dress shop or something.
What am I gonna do in a dress shop?
What you doing out here in the middle of the night?
You work too hard, Jay boy, too hard.
You should learn to relax a bit, eh?
Ask Sarge for a bit of down time.
I don't know. Just doing a bit of intelligence.
We've been working out here a long time now, a long time.
Gone a long, long way to get where we are.
And we'd really hate for someone to come along and fuck up all the hard work.
can I ask you something, if you don't mind, eh?
You know, from one cop to another.
Sounds like you're the one who needs a break.
Would you... would you tell anyone? You know, if you did?
I mean, if you could... you know, if you could get away with it, would you tell anyone?
Is there something you wanna tell me, Johnno?
Nah, I'm just fuckin' with ya, Jay boy! I'm just fuckin' with ya!
Yeah, well, I better get home to sleep.
Mate, maybe we could go out for a feed sometime.
Have a bit of a yarn.
I'd expect that from a bloke...
whose father was head stockman round these parts.
My first memory's on the back of his horse.
That's before everyone left the mission and moved into town.
Yeah, she's gonna be a hot one, alright?
I could do with a bit of amber.
I don't know what I'm looking for.
It's hard to keep track of these young girls.
What do you know about Johnno before he joined the cops?
Well, I saw him out on the highway last night with Robbo.
He was acting a bit strange.
Probably thought the same thing about you.
He got in a bit of trouble with the police up there.
I don't know the details, to be honest.
What do you reckon he was doing out there?
Don't get all paranoid on me.
Sometimes Johnno's gotta go for a while without a wash.
That red dust can be hard to get off.
What if that red dust don't come off no matter how hard you try?
Your hands are gonna get a bit grubby from time to time.
He's got some big busts coming up.
Make sure you don't get caught in the middle.
Yeah, I guess you have, you poor bugger.
I've just remembered there's something I've gotta do.
What's she hanging around those crazy girls for?
She's been hanging around them girls for years.
I don't know. Why don't you go ask her yourself.
She told me you asked her to go live with ya.
She spent the whole night in her room crying after that.
Nothing I could say to her.
Too late, Jay What happened to you?
Who the fuck do you think you are?
Livin' over there all by yourself in the big, empty house.
Who do you think you are.
What did you want me to do?
Stay around here and watch you drink your life away?
I did that one with my old man.
Hey, you weren't doing too badly yourself, remember.
At least I'm trying to make a difference in this town.
You see, I know I've got problems.
But at least I know who I am.
Well, you don't have to worry about me...
Old girl finally packed it in.
I got everything I need right here.
Until my old wheels pack it in.
You just got to be quicker than those...
Did you see them on the way in, did you?
They... they tore him to bits.
I'm sorry about your dog, Mr Murray.
He was more than a dog!
do you remember you called the police a few months ago?
You said that you saw one of those wild dogs...
You said that it was carrying something in its mouth.
You said it was a human bone.
You said that you saw one of those dogs out on the highway...
and it was carrying a human bone in its mouth.
And you said something terrible had happened.
My memory's not what it was.
the police should check the town for missing people.
You don't know what something is...
When time has its way with you...
not even your dreams can bring it back.
Why didn't you tell me Julie was murdered?
I couldn't say too much, you know? Secret police business.
You know the family who used to live here?
But I don't want any trouble or anything...
You know what I'm getting at here?
Yeah, well, that mob moved out some time ago.
No, a lot of trouble in there.
Oh, schizin' out on drugs, booze, carryin' on, fightin'.
Well, I remember the old man in there...
held the baby over the oven.
Threatened he was gonna cook the baby in the oven. Yeah.
Was there a teenage girl living here? Nelli Dargon?
Yeah, she was living there for a while, but she moved out. Yeah.
Alright, thanks, I'll catch up with you later on.
I was just wondering if I could have a word with Jasmine.
I just want to ask her a few questions about her friend...
that used to live next door...
Yeah, she was on drugs and grog.
No way. My man'd kill me and send me to hell.
But she used to see this one fella.
he'd give her drugs and grog if she'd meet him at the motel.
Did she ever say if this fella was black or white?
Do you know my girl, Crystal?
Does she ever do this kind of thing, like Nelli did?
I don't know her that well.
Do you have any regular customers?
Did any of them stay here around October 10?
Um, let me just check for you.
Do you happen to have a vehicle registration number?
No. He always left that part blank, actually.
Do you remember what this William Smith looked like?
Look, I get so many people through here...
I really can't remember. He was a pretty averagelooking cowboy, I guess.
Hey, you must have worked with that poor young police officer.
He was killed out on the highway.
He came in here to last year...
you know, asking me if I had any regulars.
Was a terrible thing for that poor man's young wife and child.
Do you happen to remember what type of vehicle...
this William Smith was driving at the time?
he always asks for the same room.
Oh, that's OK. Actually, I wanted to talk to you.
I'm just wondering whether you saw any vehicles...
pull up on the highway last Friday night.
What were you doing last Friday night?
I run the meat freezer in town.
You got any witnesses to prove your whereabouts?
So you're a roo shooter, eh?
Well, you'd be a pretty crack shot, then, wouldn't ya?
Pull a head shot from 1,000 yards.
Mind if I take a look at it?
And why would you want to do that?
Well, I was thinking about buying a hunting truck.
And what are you hunting for?
They seem to be running amuck around here these days.
Yeah, I guess I wouldn't mind...
we usually shoot at fellas who turn up here without an invite.
Especially ones of the dark breed.
Man's got a right to protect his property.
You have a good day, fellas.
Not bad, mate. We just got the results from the lab.
I'm typing up a report now.
Thought you might want to know, the light brown fibres found on the girl's fingernails are of a synthetic material.
They've got the microstructure consistent with the material found in the production of car seats.
It'll take a few weeks to get a match.
The fibres were so deep under her nails...
This girl went through a lot of pain.
We also found something a little bit strange.
The dog left its saliva on the girl...
and the lab identified a special gene in its DNA.
They're having trouble matching it with other dog DNA.
Like it was some kind of, well, superdog.
Anyway, that's just a bit of trivia.
I'll send this report over ASAP.
Bobby was at home watching the footy.
I remember it was his team playing when he got a phone call.
Said he had to go out and meet someone.
Just that he'd be gone an hour.
Two hours later I was getting worried.
So I called the station, but they said they didn't know anything.
And then the phone rang ar 3:00 in the morning.
I just had this bad feeling.
Took me a few minutes to pick up the phone.
found his car on the side of the highway...
and his body lying in a pool of blood.
Did your husband ever talk to you about his work?
Said he didn't want to bring it home to the family.
I couldn't find Bobby's case file at the station. Any idea why?
A special team came up from the city, but...
I guess it all got turned over to 'em.
Did they ever tell you who called Bobby that night?
But I know it was another policeman.
Well, I didn't hear any names but...
Bobby always spoke a certain way...
when he was talking to another cop.
Can I get a name for a registration number?
Should be a silver Excel registered to a Wayne Silverman.
Just give us the last few years.
Five counts of receiving stolen goods.
One count of break and enter, two counts of assault.
Two fail to appear for one count of car theft.
Two counts of driving unlicensed, and the list goes on.
So you heard about Julie Mason?
So what do you know about her?
She ever get drugs from ya?
Sometimes she'd come to me for a stick.
I owed a few favours to some fellas so I sent her out to give 'em a good time.
What about the missing girl, Nelli Dargon?
Fuckin' mad on money and having a good time.
They'll use anyone to get what they want...
and they deserve everything they get.
I might be able to help you.
You've got a pretty big record here.
You got two warrants right here.
So what would I find if I searched your house?
I stole a car and stripped it.
I found a case full of brown sugar in it.
On our way we stopped at Chooka Chook for a feed.
Some prick stole it from my car.
Out near the old mission garbage tip.
They all come looking for a hit sooner or later.
How do you fuckin' know my daughter, Wayne?
How do you sleep at night...
locking up your own people all the time?
Can I, uh... can I see you for a sec?
You realise what you're doing in there?
Well, brother, I have to tell ya...
you're fuckin' with my number one informer, eh?
Should watch where you step, Jay boy.
Those big boots of yours will get you in trouble.
Don't worry, I'll make sure he gets home, mate.
I pulled a few strings with the district commander.
There's a detective team coming down from the homicide branch.
I think you'd better get out of town for a few days.
Sarge, we both know what's gonna happen.
They'll do their paperwork, they'll keep their mouths shut...
and they'll go back to where they came from.
But maybe that's what you want.
There'll be more than a few black girls to worry about...
if this town turns into a fuckin' war zone...
For some people it already is a war zone.
I just come home from Bingo.
You know what they were looking for?
I don't know where she is.
What if they come back, Jay?
Got nothin' to say to you, Jay.
You see everything in this street.
I just want to know one thing.
Look, Johnno, I don't have a lot of time right now.
I know how you feel, Jay boy.
Not enough seconds in the day.
See, we've got the same problem, mate...
And I don't know about you, but I'm a real sad case.
Just the ugliest bull mastiff mongrels you've ever seen.
Well, that's a classic right there, right there.
Belonged to my old man before he passed away.
Do you think you can really use that thing?
You think you can really make a difference to this place?
Kittens in Washing machines, babies in ovens...
you know, all that fun stuff.
It was just a matter of time before it got out of control, you know.
Out of control, just like those fuckin' grassfires they always light.
So what do you know about the Bobby Rogers murder?
What were you doing out there today?
Look, what do you want, Johnno?
I just need to find out what's missing and I need to do it pronto.
You're a lucky man, Jay boy.
But you should learn to look after her.
There's a place... called Slaughter Hill.
